page.title: 19HOUSING
page.content: Housing consists primarily of older houses like cottages and farmhouses dating back about 300 years. Due to planning restrictions few new houses have been built in recent years.Several derelict oast_houses have lately been converted into modern dwelling. Due to the spreading nature of the village, many houses are rather isolated. Most cottages and houses are privately owned, although some rents are paid. .the exception is Lower Cross Cottages, which is a small estate of l2 houses owned by Rother District Council. These can now be purchased by the tenants if desired. A few houses are still 'tied cottages', let to farm_workers for as long as they work on the connected farm. No new housing development is planned or likely. See Rape of Hastings Archi_ tectural Survey about old houses.
